author: newsdesk@essexlive.news (Declan O'Reilly)
title: Met Office issues yellow weather warning to parts of Essex as delays 'likely'
text: Parts of Essex will face disruption due to strong winds over the weekend. The Met Office has issued a yellow weather warning from Saturday morning (December 30) through to the early hours of Sunday (December 31), with transport likely to be affected. The strong and gusty winds will move east across England and Wales, bringing some disruption to travel and services. This will affect the coastal areas of Essex including Southend-on-Sea, Thurrock, Clacton and Burnham-on-Crouch, as well as places like Chelmsford and Colchester. The Met Office estimates that the adverse conditions will begin on Saturday morning at around 11am, and continue until 3am on Sunday. There may be delays to road, rail, air and ferry transport as a result of the winds. READ MORE: [Essex's female criminals jailed in 2023 including baby murderer, killer driver, and drug dealer](https://www.essexlive.news/news/essex-news/essex-criminal-women-jailed-2023-8989128) READ MORE: [Essex childhood sweethearts given 'Christmas surprise' with birth of twin babies](https://www.essexlive.news/news/essex-news/essex-christmas-day-babies-2023-9000833) Coastal areas will be affected by spray and/or large waves, and some short term loss of power and other services is possible. Some bus and train services may be affected, with journeys taking longer, and delays are likely for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges. Driving in these conditions can be dangerous, so anyone getting by behind the wheel this weekend should follow the advice issued by the Met Office. This includes driving slowly to minimise the impact of wind gusts, holding the steering wheel firmly and giving cyclists, motorcyclists, lorries and buses more room than usual. Measures can also be taken to avoid causing damage to people or your property. Items like bins, plant pots and garden furniture should be secure or else taken inside your home during the period of heavy winds.

author: cfeditoren
title: ASSOCIATION FACES INTERNAL DIVISION OVER UNION ALLIANCE - Eswatini
text:
Africa-Press – Eswatini. The Royal Eswatini Police Staff Association (REPOSA) is facing internal division following moves to join the Public Sector Unions (PSUs) of Swaziland.
Recent meetings between some REPOSA executive members and PSU representatives, culminating in a Monday afternoon meeting at The George Hotel, have sparked controversy. Following this meeting, PSU leaders held a press conference announcing REPOSA’s official affiliation.
Mbongwa Dlamini, President of the Swaziland National Association of Teachers (SNAT), stated that REPOSA was now part of the five-member PSU alliance, alongside SNAT, the National Public Service and Allied Workers Union (NAPSAWU), the Swaziland Democratic Nurses Union (SWADNU) and the Swaziland National Association of Government Accounting Personnel (SNAGAP).
He emphasised that police officers, as civil servants, were workers like any other PSU member and that past differences had been set aside to foster collaboration. “REPOSA is not joining PSUs because of the Phase II issue, but because its members are workers – civil servants,” Dlamini stated.
However, REPOSA President Isaac Lukhele has denied seeking support from the PSUs, maintaining the association’s independence as mandated by its code of conduct. This followed statements by REPOSA Secretary General, Sergeant Dumisile Khumalo, indicating the association was considering a partnership with the PSUs in its legal battle against National Commissioner of Police Vusi Manoma Masango. Sergeant Khumalo explained that REPOSA had approached the PSUs for guidance after exhausting all formal avenues regarding the unresolved Phase II issue. She argued that police officers, like other civil servants, needed collective support when negotiating with government.
Lukhele, however, emphasised that police officers are governed by the Police Act, which prohibits affiliation with external unions and participation in industrial action, unlike PSU members. He suggested Khumalo’s statements were personal and not representative of REPOSA. Chief Police Information and Communications Officer, Senior Superintendent Phindile Vilakati, confirmed REPOSA had informed the police administration that it had not sought PSU support and was expected to retract Khumalo’s statement.
In response, Sergeant Khumalo defended her position, arguing that PSUs are not political organisations but unions representing civil servants.
She accused Lukhele of abandoning junior officers and aligning himself with police management, claiming his actions contradicted the wishes of the association’s members. “What I am doing was discussed by the masses (junior officers),” she asserted.
For More News And Analysis About Eswatini Follow Africa-Press

author: Jason Owens, Yahoo Sports
title: Alabama players say they're barred from watching film alone because of Michigan's sign-stealing scandal – WSB-TV Channel 2 - Atlanta
text: Alabama is taking no chances in the aftermath of [Michigan's sign-stealing scandal](https://sports.yahoo.com/timeline-how-the-michigan-sign-stealing-scandal-and-jim-harbaughs-suspension-unfolded-202315375.html). Crimson Tide players are barred from watching game film individually on their tablets as they normally do ahead of Monday's national semifinal game against the Wolverines. Instead, they're meeting at team facilities to watch film in groups. Multiple Alabama players addressed the new protocol in media sessions Thursday, including wide receiver Isaiah Bond and All-SEC left guard Tyler Booker. Head coach Nick Saban has not addressed the subject. Bond appeared to break the news while answering questions from reporters in a news conference. Per Bond, players are prohibited from watching game film on tablets by themselves. "We’ve been watching it together," Bond said of film study. "I think they said Michigan was stealing signs for the first eight weeks or something like that. Us just watching film with the team because we’re not allowed to watch film on our own. We don’t want any stuff like that to happen again." He confirmed that the protocol came down from the coaching staff. "Our coaches told us that like a week ago," Bond said. … "We’re not allowed to." The Big Ten suspended Michigan head coach John Harbaugh for the final three games of the regular season for [what it described as "uncontroverted" evidence](https://sports.yahoo.com/timeline-how-the-michigan-sign-stealing-scandal-and-jim-harbaughs-suspension-unfolded-202315375.html) of a scheme to steal signs from opposing teams. Michigan has parted with a recruiting staffer and an assistant coach with reported ties to the scandal in its aftermath. Harbaugh returned to the sideline for Michigan's 26-0 win over Iowa in the Big Ten championship and will lead the Wolverines against the Crimson Tide on Monday. Though the scandal appears to be in the past, Saban's taking no chances with a trip to the national championship at stake. Booker was hesitant to discuss the new protocol with reporters, but confirmed when pressed that players aren't permitted to watch game film individually. He doesn't expect the new protocol to impact Alabama's game preparation. "We are still treating this game, this preparation like we would any other game," [Booker said](https://twitter.com/AlabamaNati0n/status/1740483744874873269). … "We just have to make sure we're watching film whether it be on our phone or in person in the room. Just have to make sure we watch the film any way we have to get it done." Bond said that players were still getting in their normal amount of film prep. "It doesn’t change at all," Bond said of Alabama's game prep. "We’re still gonna watch the film. We’re still gonna get the hours in. We’re still gonna look over the defense, do everything we would in a regular game." He also isn't bothered that the alleged sign stealing took place to begin. Football is still played on the field. "It doesn’t even matter to me. At the end of the day, they’ve still gotta go on the field and play us. You can know my route, but you’ve still gotta guard me at the end of the day."

author: Mayela Sáenz
title: Mujer disfrazada de sirena es atacada brutalmente por enorme pez en un acuario | VIDEO
text:
Mujer disfrazada de sirena es atacada brutalmente por enorme pez en un acuario | VIDEO
El ataque del pez fue captado en video, en el cual se muestra el momento exacto en donde la mujer es mordida por el enorme pez en pleno show.
Una mujer disfrazada de sirena fue atacada brutalmente por un enorme pez cuando se encontraba realizando un espectáculo en un acuario, situación que fue captada en video y se ha viralizado en redes sociales.
Los hechos ocurrieron en el acuario del Parque Forestal Primitivo de Xishuangbanna, en China, cuando se realizaba un show para los asistentes, el cual fue interrumpido por el ataque del animal.
-
Te recomendamos
Así fue el choque de avión de American Airlines contra un helicóptero en Washington | VideoInternacional
Así fue el ataque del enorme pez en el acuario de China
Todo ocurrió mientras la joven se encontraba dentro del agua disfrazada de sirena y deslizaba su ‘cola’ cuando saludaba a las familias que se encontraban disfrutando de su show, sin embargo, de manera repentina, se acercó un enorme pez y la atacó de manera brutal sobre su rostro.
El animal abrió su gran mandíbula alrededor de la cabeza de la mujer, provocándole graves heridas en su cara, pero por fortuna logró zafarse y nadó hacia arriba para salir del agua y pedir ayuda.
-
Te recomendamos
Meta, dueños de Facebook e Instagram, deberán pagar 25 millones de dólares a Trump por suspender sus cuentasInternacional
De acuerdo medios locales, la animadora de origen ruso resultó con heridas en su cabeza, ojo y cuello, quien fue atendida de emergencia.
Estas fuertes imágenes fueron captadas por algunas personas del público, quienes quedaron impactadas al ver la agresión, pues la mujer aparentemente comenzó a sangrar.
Aseguran que mujer fue obligada a regresar al acuario tras la agresión
Algunos medios de comunicación rusos aseguran que la joven fue obligada a regresar al acuario para continuar con su show a pesar de sus heridas.
Por ello, los encargados del Parque de Xishuangbanna fueron acusados de violencia laboral y extorsión ejercida sobre la mujer, quienes ofrecieron 78 libras en compensación por los “daños materiales” tras el ataque, pero prohibieron a la animadora hablar del tema.
[@olimpicasemetio]En el Parque Forestal Primitivo de Xishuangbanna, en China , una actriz rusa, conocida como Masha, de 22 años, fue atacada por un enorme pez mientras realizaba un espectáculo acuático vestida de sirena. El evento, presenciado por decenas de niños y sus familias, generó gran conmoción entre los espectadores, quienes no podian hacer nada hacer ante el sorpresivo ataque del animal. Masha se encontraba dentro del gigantesco acuario del parque, que alberga diversas especies acuáticas. Durante su presentación, se deslizaba grácilmente por el agua usando la parte superior de un bikini y una cola de sirena, saludando a los niños y moviéndose con fluidez. Sin embargo, la tranquilidad del espectáculo se rompió cuando un pez de gran tamaño se abalanzó sobre ella y, en un rápido movimiento, mordió su cabeza. Aunque la criatura gigante solo logró arrancarle las gafas y las pinzas nasales, la joven sufrió heridas en la cabeza, el cuello y un ojo. Según informaron medios rusos, a pesar del dolor por la lesión en su cuello, Masha fue obligada a regresar al acuario para continuar con su presentación. Como compensación, se le ofrecieron aproximadamente 200 dólares por los daños sufridos, pero se le prohibió hablar del incidente, pues sus superiores en el parque intentaron encubrir lo sucedido. ????@ferrygno
[#Acuario][#pez][#peces][#sirenas][#ACUATICO][#viral_video][♬ sonido original - Olimpica St 105.9 - Olimpica St 105.9]
Hasta el momento se desconoce qué tipo de pez fue el que atacó a la joven, pues sólo se informó que en el acuario cuentan con especies nativas de los ríos Mekong y Yangtze.
Usuarios reaccionan a video sobre ataque de pez
El video de la agresión rápidamente se viralizó en varias plataformas alcanzando millones de reproducciones en Facebook y TikTok, en donde algunos usuarios expresaron que fue un milagro que la mujer quedara con vida ante tal ataque.
- “Está viva por un milagro de Dios”.
- “Pensé que era ilusionismo y parte de la actuación”.
- “Pobre chica, estaba trabajando”.
- “¿Cuándo dejarán de existir estos lugares?”, fueron algunos de los comentarios de los internautas.
